title: Director of Field Operations
description:
About Treeswift

Treeswift is revolutionizing land monitoring and management by combining cutting-edge robotics and machine learning to fundamentally upend how humans connect to landscapes. Treeswift’s technology delivers high-quality ground data at unprecedented scale to a wide range of industry stakeholders including but not limited to some of the largest U.S. timber operations, innovative carbon credit developers and major utilities managing vegetation around critical infrastructure. Treeswift’s team brings together robotics experts from top academic institutions, innovative forestry professionals and deep experience in enterprise software development in order to become the global leader in land data.

About The Role

As Director of Field Operations you will:

Lead the Field Team responsible for data collection and develop a strategy for cost-effectively growing our operations. In the near term you will oversee an in-house team of foresters and field staff, as well as external contractors. You will be responsible for timely data collection, safety in the field and overall cost management. Ensure robust operational planning. This includes overseeing the inventory of robots to ensure appropriate availability of robots for project work. As we scale, you will need to lead implementation of improved systems for operational planning and inventory management.Establish critical feedback loops between our field operations and other teams. Whether it is feedback on performance of our hardware or our AI models effectively collecting and addressing feedback from the field is critical to Treeswift’s overall success. Be prepared to tackle new challenges as they arise ! Whether it be future international deployment or customers operating our robots we are looking for someone flexible to deploy their strength in operations creatively to new challenges.

This role requires deep people management experience, ideally with teams based remotely and often in the field, meticulous organizational skills, and ability to efficiently collaborate and make decisions quickly with your counterparts in leadership. Experience managing a fleet of hardware products (or other inventory) is a big plus. You will be expected to travel to customer field sites as needed. This role reports to our VP of Product and Operations. This is a hybrid role in New York City with 2-3 days a week onsite required.

A Great Candidate…

Is a strong and proven people manager for field teams Has built, owned, and run hiring pipelines to staff Field Operations teams Has Forestry or relevant adjacent experience (i.e. vegetation management, wildfire, environmental science etc…) Has experience in inventory management and capacity planningHas a bias toward action, values experimentation, and is more interested in finding the right answer than being rightValues truthful, direct feedback, even when it can feel uncomfortableIs a driven self-starter; you don’t wait to be told what to do but rather look around, spot problems and opportunities, and share ideas you’ve brainstormed Is flexible and capable of doing many things (versus just one thing); our most successful employees wear multiple hats and are willing to work on a wide scope of responsibilities

What We’re Looking For In You

You hold a Bachelor's degree8+ years of relevant experience Supervisory experience in a field operations environmentExperience in administering processes and policies as they relate to: safety, attendance, performance work rules and code of conduct.You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels within the organizationYou have exceptional attention to detail and project management skills

What We Value

Mission before team, team before self. This means that we value low ego team members who focus on working towards the best outcomes for the customer and the business, regardless of who gets the credit. Seeking the truth. Never being complacent. Diagnosing challenges and creatively solving big problems. Comfort with radically rethinking and reshaping how things are done today.Direct feedback. Feedback is a gift and always delivered with positive intent. Owners mindset. If you see an opportunity for improvement, run with it. We believe that good ideas can come from anywhere, no matter your role.

Benefits

Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance Life insurance package and disability coverage Stock optionsPaid leave for new parents Take what you need PTO, Sick Leave, 12 paid holidays

Salary

The estimated salary range for this position is $148,000-192,000. Total compensation for this position is determined by skills, qualifications, relevant work experience, location, and other factors. This salary estimate excludes the value of any potential bonuses; the value of any benefits offered; and the potential future value of any long-term incentives. This information is provided per the New York City Human Rights Law. Please note that the range provided is applicable only to New York City-based applicants. Base compensation may vary if the work location is outside of New York City.

Treeswift is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.

If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, whether it be alternate forms of material, accessible meeting rooms, etc., please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Project Engineer
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

Develop and produce steel designs and contract documents for new and retrofit building/structural projects including, but not limited to, schools, offices, sporting facilities, hospitals, and medical office buildings.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

Under the direction of the Director of Engineering and/or Project Manager, the Project Engineer III will be responsible for the following, but are not limited to:


Provide technical assistance to the Engineering Department on project specific designs, RFI’s, and unique details.Formally respond to questions from jurisdictional agencies during the permitting and construction phases of a project.Oversee technical changes to engineering standard notes and details.Research building codes and jurisdictional approval processes that are relevant to SidePlate’s business.Test and report the accuracy, behavior, and results of developments in other software platforms (i.e. RAM, ETABS, TEKLA, SDS2, etc.Ability to manage and execute as SidePlate project from start to finish with confidence, while using intellectual property and time saving software/tools effectively.Calculate cost and determine financial feasibility of project based on analysis of collected data.Conduct field visits to observe SidePlate connection fabrication and erection. Participate in writing required observation report(s).Create computer models using preliminary drawings and/or design criteria.Develop and draw by hand project design details for construction.Develop gravity and lateral frame solutions.Produce safe and efficient structural engineering solutions.Prepare structural calculations and drawings for submission to Engineers of Record and Authorities having Jurisdiction.Review shop drawings and requests for information (RFI’s).Review, evaluate and correct structural computer models provided to SidePlate by Engineer of Record, as required.Set up and present pre-detailing, pre-fabrication, and pre-erection meetings to ensure conformance to engineering plans, specifications, and construction standards.Train Design Engineers on how to perform their essential duties and lead by example.


Education/Experience


Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Civil, Structural, or Architectural Engineering, MS degree preferred.Excellent understanding of software and code.Excellent understanding of statics, dynamics and structural load path.Five (5) or more years of experience in structural engineering.Engineer with 3-5 years will be considered for project engineer II positions.


Computer Skills: 


To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Office and have proficient skills in Word, Excel, Access, as well as various structural engineering and fabrication software platforms, including RAM, ETABS, SAP, TEKLA, and SDS2.


Other Requirements: 


Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: Licensed as a Professional Engineer in California. If the individual is subject to license requirements or professional development hours as stipulated by a state agency now or in the future, compliance is required.Meets all requirements to maintain licensure in good standing (or the ability to acquire reciprocity within two (2) calendar years following hire date).May travel up to 20% of the total work time, internally as required, to fabricator shops, to conventions, and project jobsites as necessary.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret applicable building codes, general business periodicals, professional journals, technical publications, or governmental regulations.Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as calculus, algebraic formulas, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, and ratios. 


MiTek Perks:


Flexible Paid Time Off - take as much time off as you need!Benefits begin on Day 1!Profit Sharing Plan and Annual Bonus Plan13 Paid Holidays401k Plan with Matching ContributionsPaid Parental LeaveA variety of Medical, Dental and Vision Plans to choose fromShort-Term Disability Coverage, Long-Term Disability Coverage and Life InsuranceTuition ReimbursementCareer advancement and training opportunities!


In compliance with the California Equal Pay For Equal Work Act, the pay range for this position is estimated at $101,000-142,000/year . Base pay offered may vary based on job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Please visit www.mii.com/about/careers/ to learn more about MiTek’s benefit opportunities. 

MiTek is an E-Verify and Drug and Tobacco-Free Workplace. 

We are an equal opportunity employer; and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ethnicity, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or transgender status), age (40 and over), genetic information (including family medical history), veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

For accommodation to assist with completing this application, please contact Human Resources at +1 314-434-1200.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

The Solutions Architect is part of a Global Team at MiTek that is responsible for the design and scaffolding of the architecture for projects that MiTek intends to develop.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

Responsibilities:


Software Language Agnostic. Should be able to pick up a new programming language in a week and apply it with high confidence.Easily jumps on any MiTek software team and makes immediate contributions.Humbly collaborates with Product Management, Development Leadership, Software Quality Assurance, DevOps, UX and other development teams to understand their complex problems and to determine the best architectural designs for the products MiTek creates.Works in an Agile software development environment (using Scrum), participating in daily scrum meetings, monthly retrospective and planning meetings.Develops POC to validate that an outcome can be achieved in certain technologies.Scaffolds applications to ensure scalability and re-usability.Leaves every project with detailed design documents, ensuring that the designs are well understood and correctly applied by the development teams.Contributes to the Technology Strategy.Mentors other Developers and Technical Architects on Architectural principles and best practices.Keeps up with technology, bringing to light innovations that can affect or impact MiTek; evaluates and recommends technologiesHas a unique understanding of all the MiTek products that allows them to make decisions relating to future platforms.Optimizes difficult workflows.Recommends selection, approval, and acquisition of hardware, software, networking components, and services.Attendance during regular work hours and overtime as requiredIndependently architects and leads implementation of new software solutions from scratch. title: Director, Program Management (TS/SCI)
description:
Maxar is looking for a Director, Program Management with a strong delivery record and proven project management experience to own strategic, tactical, cross-functional and technology projects and programs across multiple verticals. This role requires scoping and creating project plans, developing processes, coordinating and driving execution, and communicating to senior management on status, risks and process/product changes. The ideal candidate will leverage extensive project management experience, combined with deep analytical capabilities and a keen sense of innovation, to lead complex projects from conception to completion.

Responsibilities:

Effectively manage a set of strategic initiatives to drive the growth and transformation of Maxar’s US Government Services business. In this role, you will scope a set of large projects, track project timelines, and develop mechanisms for communicating status, risk, and business challenges.

Be adept at cross-team coordination, project management, and data analysis, with a proven history of delivering results.

Manages, through directly and indirectly reporting subordinate supervisors and peers, the coordination of the activities of a program with responsibility for results, including costs, methods and staffing. Receives assignments in the form of objectives and determines how to use resources to meet schedules and goals.

Provide guidance and direction to program team members within the latitude of established company policies.

Proactively identify issues or roadblocks, coordinate collaborative cross-functional working groups to develop solutions, and ensure solution implementation through completion.

Recommends changes to policies and establishes procedures that affect Maxar’s success.

Works on issues of diverse scope where analysis of situation or data requires evaluation of a variety of factors, including an understanding of current business trends.

Follow processes and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

Act as advisor to subordinates to meet schedules and/or resolve technical problems.

Develops and administers schedules, performance requirements and budget responsibilities. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results will add to costs and may impact the short-term goals of the organization.

Frequently interacts with subordinate supervisors, customers, and/or functional peer group managers, normally involving matters between functional areas, other company divisions or units, or customers and the company. Often must lead a cooperative effort among members of a project team.

Minimum Qualifications:

US citizenship with a current/active TS/SCI clearance.

Bachelor's Degree.

15+ years of related experience. Additional experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree.

Program Manager experience with large, multi-million-dollar programs (minimum of 5+ years of experience as a PM on projects with an aggregate annual value over $10M).

Demonstrated history of success in managing the cost, schedule, and technical performance requirements of multiple programs through all phases from inception to completion.

Demonstrated experience leading programs with cross functional workstreams, e.g., finance, human resources, engineering, sales.

Must be willing to travel to customer, subcontractor, and other Maxar locations, as necessary (time-demand variable based on candidate location).

Experience working in software development or technical engineering business.

Experience working in a business that provides products and services to the US Government.

Preferred Qualifications:

Project Management Institute (PMI) certified Project Management Professional (PMP)® or equivalent training.

Knowledge of modern software tools and technologies including cloud applications.

Knowledge of government contracting practices and understanding of the Federal Acquisition Regulations, Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations Supplements, as well as other Agency Supplements.

Knowledge of Intellectual Property protection, including copyright law and software licensing.

Background in Intelligence or Remote Sensing.

Knowledge of Earned Value Management principles; experience applying those principles to projects.

Advanced Degree, e.g. Master’s Degree in engineering or MBA

#cjpost

title: Sales Representative, Member Growth
description:
Sales Representative, Member GrowthSAPinsider | Chelmsord MA – Global Headquarters
About SAPinsider: The Largest and Most Active, Global SAP Member CommunitySAPinsider is an independent research and marketing services organization that leads the largest global SAP technology and line of business professional community with over 900,000 technology and business members. The SAPinsider members are actively using SAP to enable digital transformation and operational excellence within their respective businesses. SAPinsider members depend on our Premium Membership of research, education, networking and events to support their investments in SAP based technologies and business processes.
The RoleThe Sales Rep is a hands-on sales and business growth professional who drives Group and Company Premium Membership sales, (event attendees, annual membership and content subscription access). The Sales Rep is accountable for achieving results and rolling up their sleeves in prospecting, selling, serving and renewing members.
SAPinsider conducts 10+ global events and summits annually where the Member Growth team has direct ownership of driving paid attendee sales and member renewal performance.
The Sales Rep reports directly to the Chief Revenue Officer.
Specific Responsibilities include:Lead a high touch prospect company engagement process assuring trust relationships are established across all current subscription members and companies.Manage a dedicated territory of ~150 Global 1,000 member companies focused on new member enrollment by persona, monthly check ins and annual renewals.Achieve an annual $750,000 bookings and renewal sales quota.Achieve monthly and annual sales quotas for Premium Membership Services (annual subscription services and event delegate ticket sales).Drive greater than 80% company level annual retention for all member companies.Assure that every SAPinsider event and summit achieves its paid attendee registration goals.Work directly with the CRO and Director, Sales Operations to assure full pipeline visibility at all times and deliver timely and accurate sales and renewals reporting for management.Follow up on eCommerce registrations for Event Attendees to expand group sales within the company.Conduct prospecting across all prior event and summit attendees converting them into sales opportunities.Maintain and manage all contact history for every prospect in SFDC.Professional QualificationsAn ideal candidate will possess:Strong passion for sales and services.Direct experience in event delegate and annual subscription membership sales and service.Passion for working with IT and Business professionals on their educational needs associated to using enterprise software and technology solutions.Exceptional speaking, writing and communication skills.Excellent organizational and time management skills.Strong experience working in SFDC and SFDC Reporting.
CompensationThe Sales Rep enjoys a competitive base salary of $70,000 to $80,000 based on direct experience and a sales commission plan of 4% on the first $500,000 of bookings and 7% on all bookings over $500,000 annually. In addition, the Sales Executive is eligible for a $10,000 annual bonus for renewing >80% of their member companies each year.
On target earnings are expected to be up to $125,000 in the first year and grow from there as you build your annuity business.
In addition, the role participates in all SAPinsider employee benefit programs including:
Healthcare coverageDental care coverageLife insuranceCompany vacation plan – unlimited time offFlexible spending accountsNext Steps: Take the Lead on Your FutureSend your confidential resume and cover letter to SAPinsider Chairman & CEO at James Bedard at james.bedard@wispubs.com and reference the role in your cover letter and why this is the right next step for you.

title: Data Consultant - No experience required, salaried training
description:
Are you a graduate or junior professional looking for a career in Tech, but lack the relevant skills or experience to take that leap? Join us and we’ll equip you with the latest technical skills and professional experience, to thrive in the field and rapidly accelerate! 
A bit about us:  
We're an award-winning data and tech consultancy that's on a mission to unlock potential for people and organizations. We do this by hiring diverse, talented individuals from a range of backgrounds and transforming them into skilled next-gen technology consultants who are equipped to support our clients across a range of challenges. 
We're proud to be listed as a Times Top 100 Graduate Employer (21-22) and were recently shortlisted for 'Best Graduate Employer for Women' by Women in Tech and 'Best Graduate Employer by DataIQ, for our ongoing commitment to development and creating career opportunities in Tech. 
Why join Kubrick?  
As a Kubrick consultant, you’ll receive: 
Four months of remote, salaried training where you will spend 17 weeks mastering the fundamentals of data and developing an understanding of today’s most sought-after techniques, tools, and technologies. Commerciality training to ensure you are prepared for projects post-training. Long-term, salaried placements* with leading organizations once you have passed the training**, where you will work as a consultant on a variety of relevant projects for up to two years. *Client engagements may be hybrid, in-person, or remote. Remote, in-person, and hybrid flexibility is aligned with the client organization’s policies. **Please note, client placements are arranged by Kubrick. You will not be expected to find your own placements; however, you will be expected to interview. Opportunities to work on internal projects with Kubrick and continue upskilling between client placements. Access to accreditations through tech partners including Microsoft, Tableau, Amazon, Google, and more which are paid-for by us. Access to technical webinars to support your ongoing development. Dedicated support throughout training, client placements, and internal projects from our in-house team. The opportunity to join your client as a permanent employee after 2 years of client placements or remain with us and continue progressing internally. The opportunity to stay connected to us through our alumni program even if you do choose to leave after 2 years of client placements. Rapid career acceleration.  Data Consultant Capabilities: 
As a consultant, you will become an integral part of enterprise data teams and critical to our clients’ digital data transformation, helping businesses deliver analytical data products using modern data science and machine learning approaches. After receiving training, you will be empowered to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions in today’s dynamic business landscape.  Through practical training in leading-edge technologies delivered by our inhouse team, our consultants receive foundational knowledge of technical skills and commercial awareness. 
Overview: 
Foundational skills include Agile Methodologies, Requirements Engineering, Software Development Teamwork, Business Process Modelling, Product Design, Strategy, and Ownership. Technical skills include and are not limited to: Python, one of the world’s most popular programming languages SQL, the standard language of data querying and manipulation Snowflake and Databricks, two of the hottest data lake and data warehouse platforms Machine Learning, delving into AI's subfield to develop algorithms and models crucial for predictive analytics, decision-making, & end-to-end ML workflows Data Science, enabling analysis, interpretation, and extraction of insights from diverse data types, covering data collection, preprocessing, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA), feature engineering, model building, deployment, and result communication. Specialized sessions on Pandas for tabular data manipulation and Python Visualization for constructing and interpreting various statistical analysis plots. 
Salary breakdown during 2.5-year program: 
Our blend of high-quality training, access to exciting clients and projects, and dedicated support will set you on a rapid trajectory of career development and earning potential. 
Training salary: $50,000 0-6 months: $55,000 - $66,000* 6-12 months: $59,000 - $73,000* 12-18 months: $66,000 - $77,000* 18-24 months: $70,000 - $82,000* Experienced (24+ months): $85,000 - $95,000+ Senior Consultant (based on internal promotion) - $93,000 - $108,000+ 
*Exact salaries are based on region within the US and adjusted for cost of living.  Salary potential beyond program:  
After the 2.5 years, you will have the opportunity to earn up to $100,000-$160,000 as you progress with Kubrick or your client organization.  What we need from you 
No relevant skills or experience in data or technology is required as we’ll introduce you to everything you need to know during the four months of training and will continue developing you throughout your employment with us. 
Bachelor’s degree with a GPA of 3.0 or above. Geographic flexibility is a must - our clients are in diverse and vibrant cities across the US, including Houston, Dallas, Tampa, Philadelphia, Chicago, New York and more. (Please note, at this time, remote work in this role cannot be carried out from states on the West coast, within the Pacific Time Zone. We can provide more information about this during the recruitment process.) Curious, analytical, and great at solving problems – we don’t need any previous coding skills, just excitement to learn! Desire to work with data and learn how it can help an organization make better decisions. Flexibility, adaptability, strong communication, and the ability to work collaboratively. Dedication to continuous personal and professional development  When applying for this position on our website, please select ‘REMOTE TRAINING – OCTOBER 2024’ from the drop-down menu.  Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion:  
Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy, or caring responsibilities. We also recognize the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD, and other forms of neurocognitive variation.

title: Water Jet Operator
description:
Job Category: Service Contract Act

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Local

* * *

What You’ll Get To Do

CACI is looking for a Water Jet Operator to join the Model and Fabrication team at the Naval Surface Warfare Center at Carderock. This position is located in Bethesda, MD and is 100% on-site.

Projects in this role require the fabrication of complex and unique parts and the development and application of unique fabrication solutions to the creation of scale physical models. These models are then used to evaluate vessel structural, hydrodynamic or signature properties.

The technician will apply a comprehensive, intensive, and practical knowledge of a wide range of skills to develop and execute innovative methods to produce high tolerance finished components and models. This requires the technician to independently plan and carry out assignments in accordance with the Model Fabrication Facility policies and standard practices.

Working Conditions

The technician will frequently work inside and outside of buildings. S/he will work in cold weather. S/he may be working in the hot sun. S/he will work in environments where ventilation or respirators may be necessary. S/he must be safety minded about themselves and others. S/he will check tools and equipment, and see their capacities are not exceeded; and that tools are kept in a safe working condition.

Primary Responsibilities

More About the Role

Operating and maintaining OMAX waterjetsLoading and unloading material from the waterjet machines utilizing cranes and forklifts.Breaking edges on finished waterjet partsTaking measurements utilizing mechanical and ultrasonic equipment (plate thicknesses, out of fairness, etc.)

Technical Duties

Develop run code for CNC based waterjet and punching machine operations, apply qualitative and quantitative techniques to determine the most efficient methods to meet the end results called for in the fabrication drawings and specifications.

Maintain and repair waterjet equipment. Create quotes for waterjet parts required for repairs and maintenance.

Using knowledge of model manufacturing, material characteristics, industrial processes, metal forming, inspection methods and equipment, determine materials and methods to establish and apply cost effective setups to fabrication projects.

Use analytic techniques and technical knowledge to diagnose and determine root cause of fit and finish deviations and other fabrication issues. Develop methods and processes, with the support of technical specialist and program engineers, to ensure that the issues are resolved in production processes and similar issues are reduced or eliminated in future tasks.

Design, build and research specialized tooling and fixtures to be used to support the production of complex components. The technician will be required to produce high quality models with tight tolerances.

Provide schedule input to include projections of time required to develop jigs and fixturing, produce the first order samples or mockups, fabricate components, and assemble models, and to conduct required quality control checks and verifications.

Independently plan, layout, setup, form, fasten, and construct the objects and systems from oral instructions, sketches, incomplete drawings, complex drawings or written instructions, where there are no past precedents available.

Collect data using laser tracking equipment, ultrasonic devices, and precision measuring instruments such as calipers, verniers, electronic protractors, squares, height gauges, depth gauges, indicators, and micrometers.

General

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

3-5 years of experience as a Water Jet operatorAbility to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance.Ability to interface with project managers, engineers, shop supervisors, technical specialists, craftsmen, and other outside contractors.Strong math skillsOral communication skills.Working knowledge of MS Office, Outlook, Excel, and Word.Working knowledge of commercial CAD/CAM software.Ability to operate, program and edit CNC 2/3 axis controllers and run code.Skilled in the interpretation of complex engineered drawings, sketches and verbal communications.

Technical

Thorough understanding of geometric dimensioning and tolerance practices.Processes to include water jet cutting, bending, forming, rolling, shearing, and punching. Thorough understanding of workflow requirements, equipment capabilities, skill levels required, and amount of time needed to accomplish work.Knowledge of all industrial capabilities and processes, and any emerging state-of-the-art equipment, methods or services available.Ability to collect, analyze, and compose data Knowledge of metallic and non metallic materials (research composite materials, plastics, rubber, resins, polycarbonates, nickel alloys, bronze alloys, steel alloys, aluminum alloys, high yield steels and new research metals), and their metallurgical/physical characteristics.Ability to read and work from highly detailed drawings and specifications as well as developing components from concept sketches with minimal details.Knowledge of Shop, Facility and Division Safety Policies and requirements

Physical

Office, industrial and construction settings; the work requires the employee to spend most of the day standing, kneeling, or sitting in awkward positions. S/he will lift weights from 40 to 80 lbs. S/he will work from ladders and scaffolds, also trenches, and hard to reach places by bending, stretching, and stooping

What We Can Offer You

 We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities. We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities. For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Company Overview

CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

This posting is for a position covered by the Service Contract Labor Standards (SCA). The pay and benefits provided for this position will meet or exceed the minimum required amounts detailed in the wage determination issued by the Department of Labor and made applicable to this position, as incorporated into CACI’s government contract for the work location.

Minimum Required Hourly Wage

There are a host of other factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographical location, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.

title: Business Planning Manager
description:
Tenneco’s Motorparts (DRiV) is a world leader in the international automotive aftermarket built from the combined strengths of Tenneco, Federal-Mogul and Öhlins with 31 of the best known and respected aftermarket brands, including 14 brands 100 years or older. Our colleagues throughout 25 countries around the world work as one team, driving advancements that help our customers get the most from every vehicle, every ride, every race and every journey.

We are looking for a Demand Planning Manager. The Demand Planning Manager oversees the demand planning process across their business line in a manner that shapes a collaborative consensus plan that optimizes the balance between market opportunity and supply network capability.

The team is ready to act immediately on those candidates who are the best fit for the role. You’ll first hear from someone in Talent Acquisition to schedule a phone screen, and then the next step will be a personal interview with our Hiring Manager. We pride ourselves on moving through processes quickly, and you can be sure of transparency and prompt communication throughout.

 RESPONSIBILITIES: 

 Develop and maintain the business line/product lines rolling demand forecast each month as part of the SIOP demand consensus process, with an appropriate future time horizon  Lead the monthly demand consensus meeting & work with business unit leadership to create alignment on the consensus demand plan  Assist in development of annual plans (AOP) and reconcile them with monetized demand plans, communicate any gaps between the plans  Influence and collaborate with key partners in marketing, sales (field sales, corporate sales managers and Managers) and finance and address input gaps as identified by forecast error, bias and volatility review and other means  Ensure that the demand forecast is shared/received in the format, level of detail and timing required by all customers and supply chain partners, with documented assumptions, to achieve the various business objectives  Incorporate POS and inventory levels of key customers to assist in predicting how the business and product lines should react to product phase in, phase out, warranty, availability, demand shifts, promotions, events and competitive products.  Where appropriate, lead Collaborative Planning, Forecasting & Replenishment activities with key customers to facilitate a more accurate demand plan  Lead the assessment and impact of promotions and events on demand, using what-if analysis to create scenarios and recommendations  Work closely with Manager of Supply Planning to assist the teams in reconciling critical gaps in supply and demand, creating scenario analysis and risk mitigation strategies  Provide direction to demand planners and/or analysts (where applicable) within the business line for process execution, talent development and SKU level execution of the demand plan 

 Education:  Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain or related business disciplines.

 Skills & Experience: 

 5-8 years applicable, progressive supply chain planning experience; 2 years of formal leadership  Strong supply chain planning experience with understanding of product lifecycle and NPI  Knowledge of forecasting processes in sales, marketing, finance and manufacturing  ASCM (Association of Supply Chain Management) CPIM certification preferred  Consumer Goods / Electronics / Aftermarket experience preferred

title: Senior Electrical Controls Engineer | Machinery Design ($5,000 Sign On Bonus)
description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

The Senior Electrical Controls Engineer will work to design, test, improve, and support equipment designed by MiTek for the truss manufacturing industry. In this position you will work on robust machinery design that helps customers to improve their production output. This Senior Electrical Controls Engineer will program, debug and update all control components such as PLCs, safety instrumentation and controllers, VFDs and servo drives. You will design the full control system with schematics, control panels, electrical assembly and be involved in every stage of the system from concept to production. As an Electrical Controls Engineer you will work closely with Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineers, as well as departments such as Production, Software, Customer Service and other administrative departments to ensure a successful product.

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Design, develop, evaluate and support automated industrial machinery products with focus on Core Platform Support (CPS) in the Component Manufacturing (CM) and off-site construction industryAct as a technical lead for project execution artifacts of small to large scale deployments (i.e. cost estimates, schedules, resource needs, risks, forecasts, status, requirements reviews, design reviews, test readiness reviews, verification reviews, etc.)Lead Production and Customer Service team members through troubleshooting and root cause / corrective actionsDesign, integrate, test and debug NFPA79/NEC/UL508A compliant electrical control panels, parts and assemblies using industry best practicesDesign, integrate, test and debug industrial PLCs, VFDs and Servo drivesDesign, integrate, test, size and debug Industrial Machinery safety standards, Safety Instrumentation and ControllersWork with software developers to generate HMIs (software development experience will be a significant advantage)Develop and maintain project engineering drawings using AutoCAD Electrical (i.e. schematics, enclosures, control panel layouts, electrical assembly etc.)Develop and maintain project documentation (i.e. system requirements, equipment manuals, test plans, project notes, etc.)Ensure compliance with MiTek engineering procedures, guidelines, industry standards and governmental regulations applicable to industrial machineryPerform engineering analysis and calculations where applicableEnter new data and update existing data in MRP/ERP systemSupport Manufacturing, Marketing & Sales, Purchasing, Installation, and Customer Service organizations throughout a product’s lifecycleStay current with industry trends and emerging technologiesMentor less experienced Electrical Engineers and DesignersManage individual tasking while leading other Electrical and Robotic Engineers through project execution with minimal oversightSome travel required (up to 10% during critical on-site activities)Other duties as assigned


REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university10+ years of electrical engineering design experienceProven experience working with industrial machinery Proficiency with NFPA79/NEC/UL508AProficiency with at least one of the following: Allen-Bradley, Siemens, or Emerson PLCsAdvanced proficiency with ladder logic PLCsProficiency with power distribution, circuit breakers, & terminal blocksProficiency with Motor Controllers, VFDs, Servos and SensorsProficiency with Safety ControllersProficiency with AutoCAD Electrical or SolidWorks ElectricalProficiency performing calculations for wire gauge and motor overload sizingAdvanced knowledge of machinery, industrial sensors and low voltage power devicesExperience with various Field Bus Networks (EtherCat, Profinet, Ethernet/IP etc)Ability to rapidly diagnose & troubleshoot automated systemsAbility to work individually and as part of a teamStrong planning, organizational and decision-making skillsStrong communication skills to interact frequently with stakeholdersProficiency with Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.)


MiTek Perks:


Flexible Paid Time Off - take as much time off as you need!All Benefits begin on Day 1!Profit Sharing Plan and Annual Incentive Plan13 Paid Holidays401k Plan with Matching ContributionsA variety of Medical, Dental and Vision Plans to choose fromShort-Term Disability and Life InsuranceTuition Reimbursement Paid Parental LeaveCareer advancement and training opportunities!

title: Automation Engineer
description:
Automation Engineer - Remote, USA
About Interviewed AI:Interviewed AI is at the cutting edge of employing artificial intelligence to revolutionize the hiring process. Your Role:As an Automation Engineer at Interviewed AI, you will be pivotal in designing, developing, and implementing automation solutions to improve our AI-driven platforms. Your expertise will enhance our system's efficiency, reliability, and scalability, directly impacting our mission to innovate the recruitment process. Working closely with our development and product teams, you will identify opportunities for automation within our processes, ensuring our technology remains at the forefront of the industry.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain automated processes, tools, and scripts to increase system efficiency and reduce manual intervention.Work closely with the software development team to integrate automation techniques into our CI/CD pipelines.Design, build, and maintain automation frameworks for testing our AI-driven applications and systems.Identify, evaluate, and implement new technologies and tools to enhance automation capabilities.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand process challenges and propose automation solutions.Ensure the scalability and reliability of automation scripts and tools through thorough documentation and robust testing.
Technical Requirements:Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or C#.Experience with automation and orchestration tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Chef).Familiarity with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and developing in cloud environments.Proficiency in developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).Experience with software testing and building automation frameworks.Strong understanding of system administration and operations in a Linux/Unix environment.Ability to work with version control systems, such as Git.

title: Federal Business Development Manager
description:
The Business Development plays a pivotal role in driving growth and expansion for Client. This leadership position is responsible for identifying strategic opportunities, forging key partnerships, and driving revenue growth through new business initiatives. The role requires a seasoned professional with a deep understanding of the industry, exceptional strategic thinking, and strong leadership skills. The position requires the ability to work full spectrum Business Development – from the identification of new opportunities to pursuit, capture, and proposal submission. This position also requires the ability to interface with government customers on a regular basis. This position reports to the Chief Growth Officer of Client. This is a hybrid job position with an expectation of working from ClientHeadquarters, in Ashburn, at least two- three days per week.
Duties and Responsibilities• Pipeline Planning and execution: Develop and execute a comprehensive business development pipeline aligned with the company's objectives to achieve revenue and market share growth.• New Business Identification and Capture: Achieve revenue targets by identifying, pursuing, and capturing new business opportunities. Foster a culture of sales excellence and customer satisfaction.• Market Analysis: Analyze industry trends and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and threats. Stay informed about competitor activities and market shifts.• Partnership Development: Establish and maintain relationships with potential partners, clients, and key stakeholders. Collaborate on mutually beneficial business ventures.• Product and Service Expansion: Evaluate and recommend new product or service offerings that align with market demands and company capabilities.• Contract Negotiation: Negotiate contracts, agreements, and partnerships to ensure favorable terms and conditions for the company.• Budget Management: Develop and manage bid and proposal allocations to optimize resource allocation and achieve strategic objectives.• Reporting and Analysis: Provide regular reports and updates to the executive team, highlighting key performance metrics and progress toward growth goals.

Working knowledge of the Federal Government Cybersecurity market space is essential.• Deep industry knowledge and an extensive network of industry contacts. Preferred experience within DOD, DHS and/or the Federal Civilian marketplace.• Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and prioritize growth opportunities.• Exceptional negotiation and contract management skills.• Excellent written communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels. Full familiarity with the Shipley’s capture process and a proven track record of winning new business in the Cybersecurity and/or Enterprise IT market.• Ability to improvise, adapt and overcome challenges. An inquisitive mind and a thirst for knowledge. Ability to adapt to a dynamic business environment and make data-driven decisions.• Results-oriented mindset, with a demonstrated ability to meet and exceed revenue targets.• Willingness to travel as required to establish and maintain business relationships with government and industry customers and partners.

title: Scientist I, Quality Control
description:
Job Description

Job Summary

The QC Chemist I (internally titled “Scientist I, Quality Control”) is an entry-level role responsible for performing testing of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical dosage forms, products on stability, cleaning verification samples following written procedures and applicable SOPs, to clearly document activities performed during testing and to calculate and report results on applicable specification documents.

Essential Functions


Performs physical and chemical analysis of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical products, including products on stability, according to written methods or compendial methods as applicable, material specifications, using analytical techniques such as IR spectroscopy, UV-Vis spectroscopy, and chromatographic techniques adhering to company policies as identified in standard operating procedures (SOPs).Prepares samples for analysis involving thorough cleanliness and complex steps for analysis using chromatographic techniques and other analytical techniques as applicable.Creates and maintains laboratory record documentation (notebooks and computer-based), documents exact steps followed during analysis execution, calculates and reports results in a timely manner.Actively participates in investigation of laboratory results, when required.


Additional Responsibilities


Assists, as and when needed, scientists working in the laboratory.Informs QC Coordinator if chemical or reference standard is expired for removal from laboratory area.Performs calibration of dissolution apparatus, FT-IR, UV-Vis spectrophotometer, HPLC as assigned by the supervisor.Prepares volumetric test solutions following USP or in-house methods for wet chemical tests, standardizes such solutions as required, standardizes API for use as in-house reference standard as assigned.


Qualifications

Education

Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) in Chemistry or related field - Required

Work Experience

Less than one year testing of chemicals/pharmaceutical products - Required

1 year or more testing of chemicals/pharmaceutical products - Preferred

Skills And Abilities


Must be able to read and understand analytical procedures. - IntermediateMust be able to effectively communicate results, problems or issues, verbally as well as in writing. - IntermediateMust be computer literate. - IntermediateMust be capable of maintaining clear and concise laboratory records and communicating clearly both within and between departments. - IntermediateMust be precise and consistent in day-to-day analysis, easily trainable, and ready to learn. - BeginnerMust be able to work in a team environment and be flexible to easily adapt to changes in assignments. - BeginnerMust follow safe practices as identified in appropriate MSDS during working with chemicals, and must follow applicable state and federal regulations. - Beginner


Specialized Knowledge


Must possess a working knowledge of analytical chemistry techniques, such as analytical weighing, quantitative transfer, preparation of quantitative solutions, analytical dilutions, spectrophotometric analytical techniques, dissolution and drug release, disintegration, moisture determination (Karl Fischer, Coulometric, LOD), thin-layer chromatographic technique, gas chromatographic techniques, HPLC, and measuring physical parameters (bulk and tapped densities, and particle size by sieve analysis).Must be able to follow compendial (USP/EP/BP/JP) procedures for wet chemical tests.Must understand and apply cGMP requirements applicable to quality control laboratory.


About Us

Amneal is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, liability for service in the U.S. Armed Forces or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

title: Parkwoods Restaurant Server (Pm Shift) - Crowne Plaza Atlanta Perimeter at Ravinia
description:
Role Purpose

Great restaurant memories come from many places. The sights, sounds, scents and, importantly, service. As a Restaurant Server, you’ll welcome our guests, recommend food and drink and help keep service on-track and up to standard. By tailoring each guest’s experience to their unique tastes, you’ll create memories as delightful as the dishes.

Key Accountabilities

Make each meal a feast for the eyes and treat for the taste buds. With your own signature flare, you’ll turn our high standards into memorable meals for every guest.Own your kitchen – keep on top of supplies and equipment, and minimise waste.Tell your supervisor or duty manager about any unsafe equipment, low supplies or safety incidents.Help create a safe space by following our safety procedures and wearing necessary protective equipment.Be cleaner than clean – meet or exceed local cleanliness and hygiene laws.Help with washing up and other kitchen duties when needed.Give guests a better experience by helping with any queries or advice.Wear your uniform with pride.Take on other ad-hoc duties when the whole team needs to pull together. 

Key Skills & Experiences

Strong – sometimes you’ll need to lift, push and pull big objects up to 50lbs (23 kg). This can involve bending and kneeling.Literate – you’ll need a good grasp of reading, writing and basic maths.Flexible – night, weekend and holiday shifts are all part of the job.Compliant – as well as meeting local laws on food handling and serving alcohol, you’ll be above the minimum age required and fluent in the local language.Articulate – a great communicator, you’ll be warm, welcoming and easy to talk to.

At IHG, we’ve made a promise. As one of the world’s leading hotel groups, we’re here to deliver True Hospitality for Good. Making our guests and colleagues feel welcome, cared for, recognised and respected – wherever they are in the world. Want to be part of the journey?

Join Crowne Plaza one of the largest and best loved premium hotel brands in the world. With more than 420 hotels in diverse locations globally Crowne Plaza is the perfect base to connect on business, pleasure or a blend of both. We've thoughtfully designed our spaces to encourage, support and celebrate great connections. We're also big on meetings and events, a trusted and valued partner for connecting both domestic and global groups alike.

Our branded service style 'Dare to Connect' is crafted for connection. Designed for humans not nameless guests or colleagues. Still professional but touches guests on an emotional level. Where colleagues take their initiative and use their personality because they make a crucial difference in the guest's experience. The role of every colleague at Crowne Plaza is to create memorable emotional connections and the job of every leader is to create an environment where that can happen.

Don't quite meet every single requirement, but still believe you'd be a great fit for the job? We'll never know unless you hit the 'Apply' button. Start your journey with us today.

title: Vice President of Finance
description:
Description

Position at Century Communities

About Century Communities

As one of the nation’s largest homebuilders and industry leader in online sales, we know what it takes to be a market gamechanger, and that includes providing you with all the resources, opportunities, and benefits to build a thriving and rewarding career.

Benefits We Offer

Team members enjoy an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off, plus home and mortgage discounts. We also offer competitive salaries with the potential for discretionary bonuses and/or commission structure (depending on the position).

We Hire The Best

Our mission of building, financing, and insuring A Home For Every Dream™ is only possible with the best talent in the industry. If that’s you—if you’re a self-starter, changemaker, and thoughtful collaborator ready to take their career to the next level—then apply today!

What You’ll Do

The Vice President of Finance is responsible for the Division's financial planning and analysis, reporting, budgeting, operational improvement, forecasting, financial control systems, back-office operational efficiency, and cost accounting.

Your Key Responsibilities Include

Supervise the annual business planning and quarterly forecast update process, ensuring a high level of transparency and accuracy.Work closely with the Division President and Land Acquisition department to analyze the viability and structure of potential deals and determine the direction of future project and product positioning.Prepare and reviews all sales gross margin worksheets (sales scrubs).Review and analyze monthly financial results, including reasons for variance from the annual plan.Perform post-acquisition project reviews comparing actual results with original underwriting to identify trends or gaps and areas of improvement for future deals.Manage the land development budget update monthly.Provide analytical support to management to improve homebuilding operations and identify cost savings and revenue enhancement opportunities.Work closely with the Sales and Marketing department to establish correct project-level pricing, including base prices, lot premiums, option pricing, and incentive promotions.Work closely with the Purchasing department to reduce direct costs, track commodity pricing, and limit our plan portfolio.Serve as a local driver of process improvement efforts driven to standardized processes in all aspects of the operation.Provide support and direction to the Corporate Accounting group in preparing division financial statements and disclosure.Oversee internal control and other accounting/operational procedures within the Division.Support all division departments with special projects.Perform other duties as needed or assigned.

What You Have

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Ability to follow up and follow through on projects.Willingness to be proactive and take on additional responsibilities.Effective working relationships with vendors, suppliers, co-workers, and supervisory personnel.

Your Education And Experience

Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting.10+ years of experience in Finance and/or Accounting.MBA or Big 4 CPA preferred.4 or more years of experience in residential home building, land, or construction are required.Experience with an international manufacturing corporation is preferred.Work experience in manufacturing operations or purchasing is a plus.Knowledge of NewStar and IBM TM1 is a plus.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
OUR VISIONIn the transformative world of Web3, it is an individual’s fundamental right to own and control their digital identity. To ensure that the individual is paramount in Web3, we are developing tools that enable everyone to engage and transact online in a safe and trusted way. Individuals are in control of what information they choose to share and with whom they choose to share it. We are developing a pioneering platform that combines the power of social experiences with Web3 Identity. This platform will provide individuals with access to interactive 3D experiences, verified communities, trusted transactions, the ability to prove ownership of their creations, and visibility and control over the data collected about them -- all designed to empower and benefit every Web3 user.
We believe that the decentralized nature of Web3 creates an opportunity for everyone to challenge the digital status quo—to own and control their identity, data, finances, creations, and future. This is the chance to get it right – to rally a movement of individuals focused on ensuring that Web3 belongs to everyone, not just to trillion-dollar companies. To fulfill this vision, we are seeking dynamic people who want to join us in leading the way to this new world.
What You Will DoAs Senior Product Manager, Identity, you will own and drive the success of the identity features within our product application. You will act as a hub for gathering the requirements needed to build a web and mobile identity experience.You will be working cross-functionally with multiple teams within Blockchains to build, develop and release features related to identity. You will work collaboratively and cross functionally with your peers to support areas of focus related to profiles, identity, reputation, credentials, identity verification and gamification. You will manage proactive communication with stakeholders and ensure that they understand the features, value propositions and capabilities. You will work closely with other Product Managers, our Engineering Management team, remote developer and UX teams, Brand, Marketing, and Business Development teams to ensure a seamless experience. You are highly collaborative, and you will own the Product Backlog for our mobile product, ensuring that features are scoped, defined, and prioritized for successful development.
ResponsibilitiesGathering requirements and following our Product Development Process (PDP) to ensure that we are building our products in a structured and compliant manner.Communicating with various stakeholders ensuring that everyone has a collective understanding of the product roadmap, upcoming features, strategy, and prioritization.Creating needed artifacts for development teams to build from, such as wireframes, user flows, customer journey maps, persons, and data flows.Providing expertise in defining business, product, user, and technical metrics for product tracking.Owning relationships with third-party identity integration partners.Coordinating with Marketing, Brand, and Business Development to ensure accurate product messaging.Collaborating with our UX team to ensure a seamless user experience that meets the defined requirements.Working cross-functionality within our delivery squads to ensure on-time delivery. 
RequirementsYou are a passionate and experienced Senior Product Manager with expertise in 0-1 product development and or mobile and web consumer products.You are motivated by envisioning how web3 can bridge users to a better internet, and you are a fervent advocate for the individual user.You bring some knowledge of Web3, decentralized systems, blockchain technologies, or Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) principles.In your prior experience, you have shown that you are an excellent communicator and negotiator – able to collaborate with peers and stakeholders to get things done.You have played an active part in helping take a product in the initial stages from zero to one.You may have experience in larger companies with more defined processes and pre-revenue companies that find scrappy solutions.You live and breathe product management, with over 7 years of experience as either a Product Manager or Senior Product Manager.You have 3+ years of experience working on adjacent products (credentials, reputation, gamification, profiles, Identity Verification, integrations, and contacts).Experience working in Web3/Blockchain technologies and Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) or Social Network backgrounds preferred. 
Additional informationThe health and wellness of our employees is something we don’t take lightly. We try to make it as easy as possible for employees to take care of their bodies. Blockchains covers 100% of our employees’ medical, dental, and vision coverage costs and 50% of their dependents’ coverage.Health Insurance3 PPO plans through CignaDental InsurancePPO plan through CignaVision InsuranceVision plan through CignaLife InsuranceLife and AD&D insurance offered, $200k toward each paid for by BlockchainsFitness MembershipsDiscounted offers to more than 17,000 U.S. gyms and studios
As we grow, we want our team to grow with us. We are dedicated to fostering an environment that focuses on the personal development and professional growth of our employees. Whether this is through internal promotions, career discussions, or additional training, we strive to understand the needs, expectations, and ambitions of each team member.401(k)Employees have the option to contribute either pre-tax or Roth (post-tax) with a set dollar amount or a percentage of their paycheckProfessional DevelopmentBlockchains proudly supports employees’ desires to learn and grow. We sponsor attendance at relevant conferences and memberships in relevant professional organizations. Lunch & LearnsOnce a month, a Blockstar will take stage to help share a topic they are knowledgeable or passionate about with the rest of the team. Topics have included design thinking, poetry writing, using a crypto wallet, graphic design and animation, renewable energy, and coding 101. We believe in a holistic approach – keep the big picture in mind and try to stay balanced at work and home.Tenure-based PTOWe provide our wonderful team members with 2-4 weeks of PTO, 7 paid holidays, plus 2 floating holidaysWork from home flexibilityWe’ll admit that in prior years, Blockchains didn’t employ a work from home policy—now we do!Flexible work hoursIn addition to adopting our hybrid remote/office work policy, we offer flexible work hours. Company OutingsWe work hard, but we like to have fun! We host an annual holiday party, summer event, quarterly off-sites for team building and business planning, happy hours, and group volunteer opportunities in our local community. Team buildingHave we mentioned we like working together? We like to dabble in teambuilding and core value exercises, which improve our efficiency and ability to work as a unified team.

title: Assistant Nurse Mgr Clinical
description:
Description

title: Medical Sales Representative
description:
Inizio Engage has partnered with Integra LifeSciences, a leading Medical Device company.

The Post-Acute Sales Specialist will be a responsible for Integra’s Advanced Wound Care Total Contact Cast Products; TCC-EZ and MedE-Kast Solutions. Primary responsibility will be prospecting, lead qualification, relationship building/support, and product in-servicing/education to develop account awareness and demand of TCC-EZ/MedE-Kast Solutions. The Sales Specialists will have assigned monthly/quarterly/yearly quotas to achieve with defined growth targets. They will provide case coverage and develop accounts by building relationships, demonstrating extensive product knowledge, and providing exceptional customer service. Sales Specialist’s primary call points will be outpatient wound care centers including podiatric doctors, medical doctors, registered nurses, clinic managers, and materials management.

What’s in it for you?

Competitive compensation Excellent Benefits – accrued time off, medical, dental, vision, 401k, disability & life insurance, paid maternity and bonding time benefits, employee discounts/promotions Generous performance-driven Incentive Compensation package Competitive environment with company wide recognition, contests, and coveted awards Exceptional company culture Recognized as a Top Workplace USA 2021 Awarded a “Great Place to Work” award in 2022 and 2023 Fortune Best Workplaces in Biopharma 2022 


What will you be doing?

Target and develop new account opportunities while supporting and growing existing business within territory. Provide in-service programs to targeted accounts, which will include case coverage in the wound care centers. Provide continued education to customer to continue to support and/or grow TCC-EZ/MedE-Kast usage. Establish relationship with Program Director, Medical Doctors and key clinical staff members at wound care centers. Provide a consultative role in accordance with specific product indications. Utilize Salesforce to enter and track opportunities and activities. Develop a formal business plan at the beginning of each fiscal year to be followed by subsequent monthly and quarterly territory reports aimed at exceeding territory sales goals. Identify product improvement opportunities for sales, marketing, and product development teams. Maintain high level of technical, Integra/competitive product, and disease state knowledge. Submit weekly and monthly reports as defined by sales management. Operate within defined budgets and strictly with in accordance with policies and procedures Strictly adhere to the policies and procedures within the Advamed Code of Conduct and the Sunshine Act. Execute sales strategies in compliance with Federal Healthcare Program requirements, FDA’s promotional regulations, and Client policy. Must safeguard patient privacy and confidentiality by following the guidelines set forth in the Privacy and Security Rules of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). Perform sales administrative duties in a timely manner and as defined by management 


What do you need for this position?

Bachelor’s Degree Highly competitive with a strong track record of success. Minimum of 2 years of successful field sales experience, preferred healthcare experience. Large Territory Management experience with the ability to manage time on large value accounts and opportunities. Coachable, lifelong learner who is accepting of feedback and history of reflecting on performance that led to further improvement and success. Confidence to communicate with physicians and other clinical personnel. Excellent analytical, written, and verbal skills. Physically capable of standing for long hours during cases. Must be able to lift and carry 50lbs. Must possess a valid driver’s license. Overnight travel required, up to 50%. Ability to meet credentialing requirements to physically enter customer establishments. 


About Inizio Engage 

 

Inizio Engage is a strategic, commercial, and creative engagement partner that specializes in healthcare. Our passionate, global workforce augments local expertise and diverse mix of skills with data, science, and technology to deliver bespoke engagement solutions that help clients reimagine how they engage with their patients, payers, people and providers to improve treatment outcomes. Our mission is to partner with our clients, improving lives by helping healthcare professionals and patients get the medicines, knowledge and support they need. 

We believe in our values: We empower everyone/We rise to the challenge/We work as one/We ask what if/We do the right thing, and we will ask you how your personal values align to them.

To learn more about Inizio Engage, visit us at:  https://inizio.health/

Inizio Engage is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Inizio are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.  Further, pursuant to applicable local ordinances, Inizio will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Inizio Engage is an equal opportunity employer M/F/V/D. We appreciate your interest in our company, however, only qualified candidates will be considered.

description:

Developing Test procedures – Creating test procedures for current set of backlog items: system, functional, regression, performance, load, installation, security, interoperability, stress, boundary; defining tests for backlog items; estimating tasks needed for creating manual tests; and assessing candidates to automate for regression testsDeveloping and implementing quality assurance methodologies to ensure compliance with quality assurance standards, guidelines, and procedures in a large computer-based organization.Developing and executing software test plans, test cases, and test scripts for Integration, Migration, Regression, and/or Performance testing, and IA and disaster recovery, in order to identify system and software problems and their causes, recording defect backlog items, reporting the results of testing and resolving testing defects.Establishing and maintaining a process for evaluating hardware, software, and associated documentation and assisting in their evaluation.Mapping tasks and tests to backlog items (requirements traceability).Supporting independent User Acceptance TestingActing as a member of a product team supporting teammates and collaborating with a do what it takes attitude to ensure product and team success.Active participation in Agile Scrum sprint planning, artifact creation, sprint testing, regression testing, demonstrations and retrospectives and solution releases.Work closely with developers, professional services team and product managers to define the automated testing components that will be used to validate requirements against developed software.Work closely with Product Owners to understand product specifics and to create corresponding automation test strategies.Assist with design of test scenarios and test plans to ensure that automated tests can be implemented and executed against.Assist with creating project resource estimates, metrics to track completion phase, defect reports, defect prevention, development efficiency and qualityContribute to an atmosphere of cross-functional teamwork within the organizations agile project lifecycle.Run test validations at various levels including DB validation, logging validation, and UI validation.

You Have

Equivalent professional experience coding in an object-oriented language is accepted in lieu of degree.
